description: Nietzsche, the death of God, Lulu's seduction, alienation, repression, expressionism, fin de siecle decadence, Freud's Vienna, Kafka's Prague, the Weimar Republic, Hitler as a Chicago gangster, Brecht's epic theater, Tucholsky's laughter, Marlene Dietrich, and the femme fatale philosophy of Lou Andreas Salome... The era 1870-1945 represents a crucial period in the history of German culture and german literature provides an important sensual and analytical forum in which one can expore this decisive moment. Drawing on the writings of Nietzsche, Wedekind, Schnitzler, Freuc, Salome, Mann, Kafka, Hesse, Tucholsky, Todller, and Brecht as well as films of the Weimar Republic, GRMN 361 explores the dissonance and discontent which arises in the 19th and early 20th century as a reaction to the expanding modern world. Through close readings, critical dialogues, and intensive writing proactice, the course seeks to introduce students to not only an important phase of German literature and culture but also to an engagement with the modern world which still resonates in our contemporary, postmodern time. All readings, discussions, and writings are in German.
name: DISSONANCE & DISCONTENT
